meanings.definition: To go before in place or time.
meanings.sent1: The sun will forego the moon in the sky tonight.
meanings.sent2: I always forego breakfast before going for a run.
meanings.sent3: I decided to forego my usual morning coffee and chaos ensued.
meanings.sent4: The student's excitement foregoed any sense of tiredness during the field trip.
meanings.sent5: The anticipation of the upcoming vacation foregoed any worries about work.

meanings.sent1: The appetizers will forego the main course at the dinner party.
meanings.sent2: The opening act will forego the headliner at the concert.
meanings.sent3: The eager puppy tried to forego the leash and run ahead.
meanings.sent4: The early morning birdsong foregoed the alarm clock's ring.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh flowers foregoed the arrival of the florist.

meanings.definition: To go before in rank or importance.
meanings.sent1: Experience should forego age when considering a promotion.
meanings.sent2: Quality should forego quantity in this case.
meanings.sent3: The small bakery foregoed the big chain store in popularity.
meanings.sent4: The humble teacher's wisdom foregoed the flashy speaker's charisma.
meanings.sent5: Kindness should forego pride in building relationships.
